name: 專題討論（二）
goals: The objectives of this course are to provide graduate students with the knowledge and understanding about recent development and research trends in the field of earth sciences.
syllabus:
\[16+2. Flexible weeks plan: Self-Learning. Reading material provided by faculties, speakers and students\]  
Week 1. Introduction  
Week 2-16. Presentation to be given by invited speakers and graduate students on earth sciences-related topics.  
Week 17&18. Self-Learning. Reading material provided by faculties, speakers and students

methodologies.note: Content is provided by lectures of invited speakers and presentations of graduated students with multimedia.

After lectures and presentations, intensive discussions are encouraged to make graduated students understand the
topic deeply and exchange academic ideas.

grading.note: Score is graded based on the regulations of the NTNU and Earth Department

prerequisite: ◎Unavailable for M.A. program students (M.A. program courses excepted) and B.A. program students.
